name: Roti
short_description: Warm and versatile, roti is a staple in Indian cuisine, made from wholemeal flour and cooked on a traditional tava. Its slightly nutty flavor enhances any meal, perfect for scooping up rich curries.

name: Naan
short_description: Originating from India, naan is a soft, chewy flatbread traditionally baked in a tandoor. Its subtly sweet flavor, enriched with milk and a hint of yeast, makes it the perfect accompaniment to curries and stews.

name: Chutney
short_description: A staple in Indian cuisine, chutneys burst with vibrant flavors from fresh herbs, spices, and tangy fruits. Perfect alongside tandoori chicken or aloo paratha, they elevate every bite!

name: Biryani
short_description: Originating from the Mughal Empire, fragrant biryani layers aromatic basmati rice with marinated meat or vegetables, simmered with a symphony of spices. Each bite bursts with rich flavors and history.

name: Dal
short_description: A staple of Indian cuisine, dal features lentils simmered with aromatic spices like cumin and turmeric, creating a warm, hearty stew. Enjoyed across South Asia, itâ€™s both nutritious and comforting.

name: Tandoori
short_description: Cooked in a traditional clay tandoor, this Indian technique infuses meats and breads with smoky flavors while achieving a perfect char. Expect tender, spiced dishes that celebrate centuries of culinary heritage.

name: Butter chicken (Murgh makhani)
short_description: Originating in Delhi in the 1950s, this beloved Indian stew features tender chicken simmered in a luscious tomato and butter sauce, enriched with creamy yogurt and aromatic spices.

name: Korma
short_description: Aromatic and indulgent, this Mughlai stew features tender meat or vegetables braised in a creamy blend of spices, nuts, and yogurt, creating a rich flavor profile that delights the senses.

name: Tandoori chicken (Tandoori murgh)
short_description: Marinated in spiced yogurt and grilled in a traditional clay oven, Tandoori chicken bursts with smoky flavor and tender juiciness. A beloved staple of Indian cuisine, it showcases vibrant spices and culinary heritage.

name: Tikka
short_description: Boneless chicken pieces marinate in a rich blend of yogurt and spices like turmeric and cumin, creating a tender, flavorful delight. Originating from India, tikka is a beloved staple in vibrant cuisine.

name: Paratha
short_description: Golden-brown and flaky, paratha is a beloved Indian flatbread often enjoyed at breakfast. Layered and crisp, it pairs perfectly with curries or yogurt, showcasing the rich flavors of Indian cuisine.

name: Chapati
short_description: Unleavened and golden-brown, chapati is a staple flatbread from the Indian subcontinent, skillfully cooked on a griddle. Its warm, nutty flavor perfectly complements a variety of curries and vegetables.

name: Idli
short_description: Soft and fluffy, these savory rice cakes from South India are steamed to perfection and often enjoyed with coconut chutney and sambar. A wholesome breakfast that embodies the essence of traditional Indian cuisine.

name: Vindaloo
short_description: Originating from Goa, vindaloo showcases a tantalizing blend of spices and tangy vinegar, delivering a fiery punch. Choose from tender pork, chicken, or beef, each simmered to perfection in a fragrant curry.

name: Kheer
short_description: Creamy and aromatic, this ancient Indian rice pudding combines fragrant basmati with rich cashews, almonds, and a hint of cardamom and saffron. A festive favorite, it delights at every celebration.

name: Dosa
short_description: Originating from South India, dosa is a crispy, golden pancake made from fermented rice and black gram batter. Its delightful crunch and nutty flavor, often enhanced with ghee, pair perfectly with spicy chutneys.

name: Chana masala
short_description: Originating from North India, this vibrant chickpea curry bursts with tangy tomato, aromatic ginger, and garlic flavors. Often enjoyed as a hearty meal or snack, it embodies the essence of Indian vegetarian cuisine.

name: Chaat
short_description: Savory and vibrant, chaat tantalizes the taste buds with a delightful mix of salty, spicy, sweet, and sour flavors. Hailing from India, these irresistible snacks are often crafted with crispy puris, tangy chutneys, and fresh herbs.

name: Vada pav
short_description: Mumbai's beloved street food features a spicy, deep-fried potato vada nestled in a soft pav, perfectly complemented by garlic chutney and hot peppers. A burst of flavor in every bite!

name: Chicken tikka (Murgh tikka)
short_description: Succulent chicken pieces marinated in a vibrant blend of red chili powder, ginger-garlic, and spices are grilled to smoky perfection. Originating from North India, murgh tikka tantalizes with bold flavors and tender texture.

name: Hyderabadi biryani
short_description: Originating from the royal kitchens of Hyderabad, this fragrant biryani layers tender marinated goat, mutton, or chicken with aromatic basmati rice, infused with saffron and yogurt. Each bite offers a tantalizing blend of spices, making it a celebrated culinary masterpiece.

name: Chicken 65
short_description: Originating from Chennai, India, tender chicken pieces are marinated in a spicy blend of ginger, lemon, and red chiles, then deep-fried to crispy perfection. Each bite delivers a burst of flavor and heat, making it a beloved snack or appetizer.

name: Palak paneer
short_description: A beloved staple of Indian cuisine, creamy palak paneer features tender paneer nestled in a vibrant spinach sauce, enriched with tomatoes, garlic, and aromatic spices for a comforting, flavorful experience.

name: Appam
short_description: Bowl-shaped and fluffy, appam hails from South India, particularly Kerala. Made with fermented rice batter and coconut milk, it offers a delicate sweetness, perfect for pairing with savory curries.
